projects.title: Stack Overflow Clone
projects.description: This project is a prototype of Stack Overflow, designed and implemented as a 3-tier distributed web application. It incorporates user and admin personas and features such as reputation management, views, and pagination.The application is built to handle high volume traffic, using technologies such as Kafka for event streaming and Redis for caching. It also implements token-based authentication to ensure secure user access.

projects.title: Uber Eats Clone
projects.description: This is a food delivery application, similar to UberEATS, using Redis, Kafka, and GraphQL. The project featured customer profile management, restaurant search, food preference filtering, order placement, and restaurant menu editing. I implemented a scalable microservices architecture with message queue middleware using Kafka to handle additional load. The application aimed to provide a seamless user experience and efficient communication between components.

projects.title: Etsy Clone
projects.description: This project is an Etsy clone, leveraging technologies such as Redux, Node.js, MongoDB, and GraphQL. The application allowed users to create profiles, browse and search for products, filter by categories, add items to their cart, and make purchases. I implemented a scalable microservices architecture with efficient communication and data retrieval using GraphQL. The project aimed to replicate the functionality and user experience of Etsy while incorporating modern web technologies.
